paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene, specifically the V30M mutation, its effects on protein refolding kinetics, and its association with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP).

patients.demographics: Higher incidence in Portugal, also found in Sweden, Japan, Brazil, and Majorca.
patients.phenotype: peripheral and autonomic neuropathy, associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP)

functional_data.summary: V30M-TTR refolds at a much slower rate than WT-TTR, increasing the probability of amyloid formation.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation is associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP), suggesting segregation with disease.
variants.population_frequency: Prevalent in specific populations, but exact allele frequency not provided.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional studies and clinical association.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is the most common TTR mutation associated with FAP.
key_quotes: One of the most common TTR mutations, V30M-TTR, is associated with peripheral and autonomic neuropathy at the early stages of the disease (FAP).
The amyloidogenic variant V30M-TTR refolds about five-times slower than WT-TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR gene and its variants.
